title: Generate images with OpenAI
text: In this tutorial, we will explore how to generate images using OpenAIâ€™s image generation API in R. The openai package provides a simple way to interact with OpenAIâ€™s models, making it easy for R users to create AI-generated visuals. Whether youâ€™re a data scientist, researcher, or hobbyist, this guide will help you get started with generating images programmatically.

title: Generate images with OpenAI
section: Install and Load the openai Package
text:
Install and Load the openai Package
Before we begin, make sure you have the openai package installed. If you havenâ€™t installed it yet, you can do so using:
install.packages("openai")
Load the package into your R session:
library(openai)

title: Generate images with OpenAI
text:
Setting Up Your API Key
To use OpenAIâ€™s API, you need an API key. If you havenâ€™t already, sign up on OpenAIâ€™s websiteand obtain your API key. Then, store it securely in your R session:
Sys.setenv(OPENAI_API_KEY = "your-api-key-here")
Alternatively, you can store the key in an .Renviron file for persistent access.

title: Generate images with OpenAI
text:
Basic Image Generation
Hereâ€™s a simple example where we generate an image of a futuristic city:
response <- create_image(
  prompt = "A futuristic city skyline at sunset with flying cars",
  n = 1,  # Number of images to generate
  size = "1024x1024"  # Image size
)

# Print the response to get the image URL
response$data$url

title: Generate images with OpenAI
text:
Customizing the Output
You can modify the n parameter to generate multiple images at once:
response <- create_image(
  prompt = "A cyberpunk-themed street with neon lights",
  n = 3,  # Generate three images
  size = "1024x1024"
)

# View all generated image URLs
response$data$url
